t: What happens to a book that gets taken down by Amazon or any other publishing company? - Quora
s: Answer: Nothing. It's dead, out of print. You still own the book rights so if KDP terminated your account and took your book down as they have been doing to many, there is nothing preventing you from republishing the book elsewhere. KDP does not rule the world and you have every right to publish...

t: History of Amazon - Wikipedia
s: 1 week ago - In March 2022, Amazon announced that they would be closing all 4-star stores, along with their Books and Pop Up stores, across the US and the UK, stating that they were refocusing on their grocery and fashion stores. Amazon has grown through several mergers and acquisitions.

t: Amazon Quietly Removes Some Dubious Coronavirus Books | WIRED
s: March 11, 2020 - But the retail giant is confronting more than just an influx of sketchy coronavirus supplies. Its bookstore has become a source of dubious information about the outbreak, and Amazon has quietly begun removing some books about the virus from its virtual shelves.

t: Unpublishing and Deleting Books - Kindle Direct Publishing
s: To remove a book from sale, you can unpublish it from the KDP Bookshelf. This means new copies cannot be sold on Amazon.

t: Amazon to shut its bookstores and other shops as its grocery chain expands | Reuters
s: March 3, 2022 - Amazon.com Inc said on Wednesday it plans to close all 68 of its brick-and-mortar bookstores, pop-ups and shops carrying toys and home goods in the United States and United Kingdom, ending some of its longest-running retail experiments.

t: Remove Book from Amazon
Amazon shutting down its global online bookseller | Fox Business
s: The global online bookstore owned by Amazon is shutting down at the end of April after running for almost two decades. The move comes as Amazon continues to rein in costs.
